Title: Wakeful rest compared to vigilance reduces intrusive but not deliberate memory for traumatic videos
Author: Horlyck, Lone D.; Bisby, James A.; King, John A.; Burgess, Neil
ResultSummary: Wakeful rest had lower intrusions than 0-back vigilance task

Title: Motion effects on intrusion development
Author: Krans, Julie; Naring, Gerard; Holmes, Emily A.; Becker, Eni S.
ResultSummary: The difference between the configurational gum- chewing condition and the no-task control condition was not significant
Notes_fromMo: Contact Emily for sample size; author provided info for sample size and trauma film duration

Title: Investigating the effect of proactive interference control training on intrusive memories

Title: Effects of dual task interference on memory intrusions for affective images
Author: Pearson, David G.; Sawyer, Tina
ResultSummary: Both conditions did not significantly in terms of diary intrusions.
